website_summaries.verdict: Huge TINKERTOY set with 200 pieces that will allow for plenty of creativity and free play.
pros: Young children will love all of the different pieces and colors in this set, which includes flags, rods, end caps, and spools
Instructional ideas for 30 models, but children also can use their own creativity
Excellent set for experienced builders who want more pieces
cons: Higher price than some other TINKERTOY sets, although it has lots of pieces

customer_reviews.title: I did buy two boxes and would like another set
customer_reviews.text: My 2 year old and 4 year old have a million toys- this is there go to toy. As a stay at home mom they play with this atleast 3 hours a day! No joke! I did buy two boxes and would like another set. I dont think one box would be enough for any child. The boys have made towers, a lawn mower, fake play guns, airplanes, Bridges. My boys are constantly building and playing. This is a must buy! My son is 2.5 and can just now snap them together like his bigger brother.
customer_reviews.author: Chrissyshoptx

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased five sets of the Tinkertoys because in order for children to really have fun with them...several sets are best. That is especially true if more than one child is playing with them. The 200 piece set was good because it had a lot of basic pieces. It is the perfect first set. The pieces are sturdy. They are bright. I also bought a plastic container with a lid to store all five sets and I laminated the instruction sheets. This summer, I let my niece have the Tinkertoys to help entertain her children over the hot summer months. The children play with them a lot. I like the plastic Tinkertoys.
customer_reviews.author: Joy2u2

customer_reviews.title: Not all parts were included & so disappointed children
customer_reviews.text: With kids looking forward to the arrival of this special toy, there was great disappointment when we finally brought out the promised new toy. Four of the most valuable parts were missing: four red grid door/fence pieces were not there. Many of the projects the instructions suggest building require the red grids. It's not possible to build any of them. The box we received was new with all parts contained in two sealed bags. Well, all parts but the four grids. Had all parts been there, we would have had a fun day.
customer_reviews.author: Rick and CarolynTop Contributor: Pokémon

customer_reviews.title: Hard to put together
customer_reviews.text: Kids love them. I have a 3 1/2 and 4 1/2 yo. Only problem is that you have to push hard and pull hard to get them together or off. My kids cannot do this so I have to do it. And I tell you it's sometimes difficult for me to get the pieces to stick. So they are awesome but don't expect kids this age or even probably up to about 6 or so to be able to properly put them together.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay together
customer_reviews.text: Bought this a couple years ago when it was on sale and we finally opened it since my son is now at the right age to play with it. He loves building his own creations but everything we build falls apart. The pieces don't click together very well. We made the windmill and one of the green pieces kept falling out every time we spun it. I'm pushing the pieces together as hard as possible but they just dont stay together. I had the wooden set growing up and now I wish we had kept it because the plastic pieces are crap.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Aguilar

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy projects for ages 5+
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my six-year old grandson. Unlike the original wooden version I had as a kid, these actually stick together and allow you to make things that work. His nine year old sister plays with them, too. As my son said, they're a big hit. I nearly passed these up because it showed 3+ in large type. No, these are better suited to five and older. Unless someone rescues the venerable Construx toy from oblivion (we still have them and the kids love them) these are your best bet.
customer_reviews.author: James Bass

customer_reviews.title: cheap plastic
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for Christmas to add to an existing older set of Tinker toys and was very disappointed by the quality. The plastic is cheap and bendable, so whatever the kids build won't hold together, especially if it's anything using the wheels. The pieces from the old set are MUCH sturdier, so the kids were able to make cars and lawnmowers that would last until they took them apart. Not the case at all with this set and had I not missed the window, I for sure would have returned it,
customer_reviews.author: lew

customer_reviews.title: Over priced
customer_reviews.text: I loved the wooden tinker toys as a kid so I bought these for my 5 year old. Gotta say, I’m disappointed. There are 34 fairly pointless pieces. Even looking at the suggested designs in the pamphlet the pieces are only used a couple of times. Not sure why they include so many and not give enough sticks, joints or wheels to make anything fun or interesting. If the set was put together differently I might have bought more but as it is, buying the set isn’t worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Present for my 3yr Old
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 3yr old for Christmas and out of all the things he got, I think this was the favorite. There are tons of pieces to play around with and we've had a lot of fun so far just creating random things. We've tried similar toys/kits and this is by far my favorite as the pieces go together and come apart easily and some pieces even bend. He tends to be rough on toys and I feel like these are going to last him for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Bran

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the older wooden sets
customer_reviews.text: I had the wooden kind when I was a kid. These don't break and splinter if used too roughly. The fit is tight enough to hold but easy enough for my five year old to manipulate. Great for imagination play. The 200 piece set has enough variety to make for lots of creativity. Some people in the reviews had a problem with the red frame things being missing but it wasn't the same for me. All the pieces were there.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey Ellis

customer_reviews.title: Not enough pieces, hard to assemble and take apart
customer_reviews.text: Tinker toys are a classic. These are really fun, however, there aren’t enough pieces included to really make something cool so you’d have to purchase several sets. For how much these cost there should be more included, in my opinion. Additionally, some of the parts are really difficult to put together and take apart, even for an adult, let alone a small child. The older plastic tinker toys were a lot easier than these new designs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Like it...
customer_reviews.text: The pieces seem to require too much strength for my 3 & 1/2 year old daughter to snap together and pull apart. Maybe this problem will go away as they get worn in or as she grows into it. Otherwise is seems like a quality set with many pieces. Note, many of the 200 piece count are the small connectors so don't expect to be overwhelmed with the larger ones, however it still seems like enough for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Michael McCobb

customer_reviews.title: Creativity and Imagination Explosion!
customer_reviews.text: This huge box of Tinker Toys is not our first purchase, it's actually our second box. My boys love these! We watch BattleBots every week, and my boys use these Tinker Toys to create their own BattleBots. I love seeing the creativity that emerges using these toys! My boys are 5 and 7 years old, and these Tinker Toys are easy enough for my 5 year old, and my 7 year old has enough pieces to create something with more complexity. The pieces are very durable and the colors are bright. They've definitely been put through a lot! I highly recommend these Tinker Toys to promote creativity and imagination!
customer_reviews.author: Niaja

customer_reviews.title: They use their brains and building skills which is better then sitting on an iPad or phone.
customer_reviews.text: My two and four year old grandsons love these and that is why I bought another 200 piece set so they both can enjoy. The two year old has some problems getting them apart sometimes but hardly have to help him. My four year old has come up with quite a few original accomplishments and loves building tools with these tinker toys. I even printed out about twenty pages of different things they can make from the web site. Well worth doing.
customer_reviews.author: derfman

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: so my 5 year old loves to tinker and invent things and he built this in a day. He loves it and showing off the 'invention,' as he puts it. quality and pieces are great, for 200 pieces $40....i think its reasonable...think about how expensive Legos are. Of course I wish I could give him more pieces...given how large he builds things... highly recommend it
customer_reviews.author: Tina M

customer_reviews.title: Only 163 pieces in box
customer_reviews.text: This came in a sealed box. It looks like it is straight from manufacturer. There were only 163 of the 200 pieces it says. It took my 4 year old all of about 15 seconds to say that the set was missing two of the piece types, so I counted them up and sure enough pieces were missing. I can't exactly take his new toy away from him, so I can't return or exchange it, so I guess I just get to eat it. It makes me wonder if these aren't really from the manufacturer... maybe a knock off?
customer_reviews.author: Living The Dream

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC TOY
customer_reviews.text: We picked up the first box on Prime day for our 3 year old. He loved them and we ended up getting a second box so that we could build bigger things. Fantastic toy, well made high quality plastic. My toddler will sit and play with these for at least an hour, which is amazing to me. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: RCIstl

customer_reviews.title: Disgusted by lack of quality control that this made it ...
customer_reviews.text: Opened box with my son to find a variety of random used toys, not Tinker Toys. Disgusted by lack of quality control that this made it through to the customer!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn A Ross

customer_reviews.title: My 3 1/2 year old really enjoys these, but ...
customer_reviews.text: My 3 1/2 year old really enjoys these, but he has small hands and has a hard time with them still. He loves sitting with me and looking at the suggestion book and helping me make the suggested projects.'Update: He is now 4 and 4 months and he still struggles. Still likes them but he can't take them apart at all, IN fact I find they are hard to take apart at certain sections. But these are holding up well and hopefully he will grow into doing them on his own.
customer_reviews.author: DD67

customer_reviews.title: These are great and made well
customer_reviews.text: 200 is the amount you need; 100 is not enough. These are great and made well. The kids love them, ages 3-10
customer_reviews.author: Rosie

customer_reviews.title: 2+ yr-old Granddaughter liked this very much as a Christmas present.
customer_reviews.text: Watching my 2+ year old granddaughter play with this on Christmas morning with her parents supervision, I saw that it helps develop manual dexterity and spatial recognition. A good toy at a fair price. I wish I had kept my old wooden Tinker Toys... but these are nicely built, A good size for small hands, and the assortment of parts is good for experimentation and building lots of "things!" Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Fred

customer_reviews.title: Endless possibilities!
customer_reviews.text: I first bought a tinker toy set two years ago on a 50% off Amazon flash deal. My kids (boys 9, 5, 3, and 2yo girl) love this toy, but it wasn't enough pieces for all of them to build like they wanted so I purchased this set to expand our current collection. I'm amazed at all the things their little imaginations come up with: dinosaurs, racecars, motorcycles, buildings, robots. This is a fantastic toy that keeps them busy for hours. It doesn't get old because there are so many open ended possibilities. I would rather they play with this than screens all day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and creativity inspiring toy
customer_reviews.text: This is just like the classic wooden version I had as a kid except improved as plastic. I bought my daughter a set for her 4th birthday and she loved them. She's now 10 and still plays with them so I bought an addition set to give her more options. Her latest creation was amusement park rides for her Barbie dolls. This is a great gift for kids.
customer_reviews.author: QueenSoquel

customer_reviews.title: Tinkertoy Set is Amazing
customer_reviews.text: The Tinkertoy 30 Model Super Building set was for our 5 year old grandson but the whole family loves it. Anything you can imagine can be built from this set as well as building from the diagrams that can be downloaded. Our 11 year old granddaughter liked it so well she added it to her Christmas list. Other building sets are very popular but tinkertoys add a different dimension to the imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Granny Dee

customer_reviews.title: I was very disappointed with this product as my son loves the old ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 4 year old for Christmas, he didn't want to play with it at all. The plastic pieces are too hard to push together and pull apart, even for adults. I was very disappointed with this product as my son loves the old wooden tinker toys. This toy doesn't even encourage creativity because it's so hard to put together the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: M. Covert

customer_reviews.title: Fun toys
customer_reviews.text: My two year old loves these. They are fun and easy to assemble and come with fun design instructions. I wish it came with more pieces though. You have to make one design at a time because there is a very limited amount of each piece. For $40 I would think you could get more.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but need more of the basic building pieces
customer_reviews.text: These are fun, and both my 4 and 7 year old love to build things. The issue we have is that while it says 200 pieces, the pieces that they include the most of are the ones that aren't necessary used as often. There should be more of the basic round cylinders and sticks, instead of all the random ones that aren't as useful.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Impressed and imaginative
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. I bought a set for my 4 year old son for Christmas. I was having second thoughts because I wasn’t sure if he’d actually like them or use them. They ended up being a huge hit, is older brothers and sister play with them also. They make all kinds of things out of them. I ended up getting a second set. They haven’t broke and we haven’t had any connections wear out. It was a great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: pumpkin

customer_reviews.title: So fun!!
customer_reviews.text: These are a huge hit with my 4 year old, 2 year old, and husband! Easy to put together and the box has a great mix of pieces. They can be a little tough to take apart sometimes but they are so durable that it doesn’t hurt to yank on them. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Eric and Abby

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT toy for children that is MADE IN THE USA
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 5 year old son for Christmas 2019. I was afraid it might be too "young" for him, but he put his LEGOs down, and can't stop building all sorts of really neat things with Tinker Toys. I am very impressed with the quality and durability of this toy. Even my 7 year old daughter enjoys playing with them. This is a toy that allows kids to be creative and imaginative and also enhances logic.
customer_reviews.author: Some Clear Jenna

customer_reviews.title: Great open ended toy, hours upon hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: We got this for our kids for Christmas and at first, they didn't know what to do with it, as there were very few instructions (as they are used to with Lego). However, they quickly started making their own inventions, from small to large, and they play with this often. It has provided hours upon hours of fun. I only wish I had gotten two sets, as the box is only half full and I think a full box would allow for so many more awesome creations. But even as is, I recommend it. The kids love it.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Louise

customer_reviews.title: Missing red grid pieces
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with how these are made. Bought 3 boxes and 1 of the boxes were missing the the 4 red net grid pieces. We had already combined all the parts before we realized it, otherwise would have sent the box with missing pieces back. I have tried to figure out how to contact seller to get the missing pieces but have not fingered out how to do so. They are pretty expensive to not have all the parts, pretty important pieces at that. They are the first pieces my 3 and 6 year old went for. Other than that we’ve been really impressed with these new tinker toys.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Great for all ages and not only humans!
customer_reviews.text: Lots of fun, millions of options for new constructions, great colors, easily cleaned in the dishwasher. We build new projects every other week and fill the open holes with millet treats for our flock of pet birds. Yep, we are crazy! But laugh for days watching them picking it over and discovering new gymnastic moves in order to reach some of the hidden treats. Teaches the baby birds about balance also. Who would have thunk?
customer_reviews.author: Savagiana

customer_reviews.title: As fun as they ever were
customer_reviews.text: We got this to build little playgrounds and whatnot for our birds to climb on. They love it! Some of the connectors are a little easy to break, so that's a slight drawback. You get a lot of pieces in the set though, so it is still a pretty good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Yakbeard

customer_reviews.title: So fun but hard to pull apart
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful. Based on another review, we decided to buy 2 boxes. It was a wise choice. Our 3 yo daughter loves building and finds all sorts of fun things to make. The bendy sticks are especially fun. My only complaint is that it is hard for our daughter to push the pieces together fully and pull them apart. Even I have to tug pretty hard to pop some of the pieces off from others. I wish they were a little easier to piece together so our daughter could play more autonomously. As it is, I need to build (and tear down) with her.
customer_reviews.author: Ramen

customer_reviews.title: This is the best toy he has
customer_reviews.text: Son is 4. He's been using these since he turned 3. We have 3 sets of them equalling 500 pieces. This is the best toy he has. He builds with them each day and they stem his creativity. He loves them much more than Legos. I bet he'll love Legos more as he gets older but for now...these are the best. He's built bridges, windmills, animals for his sister. We love this toy. I have friends whose children have them and they don't get as in to them as my son...but then again, they are not 'builder' kids. If your child is a builder (not a dress up kid or car kid) this may be their thing.
customer_reviews.author: Mt. View Parents

customer_reviews.title: Great fun
customer_reviews.text: When I bought this item for my 2 year old grandson I never thought it would be such a hit. Both my 2 year old and 5 year old grandsons love these. They play with them constantly creating new ideas and then incorporating them in their play. They offer endless creativity especially if an adult helps spark an idea. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: kathryn renko

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase overall
customer_reviews.text: The 7 year old was excited to get more toys to add his collection. This set is compatible with the other ones he's had a few years. There are a lot of connectors. I wish there were more sticks, though. Great purchase overall.
customer_reviews.author: Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great for the children to learn to assemble objects
customer_reviews.text: A little difficult for the little girls to push the pieces together. Once together they stay in place but then they are a little to disassemble. The little girls 2 and 4 really enjoy building with the set.
customer_reviews.author: Dale R. Morris

customer_reviews.title: My son’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: My son and his friend love it! Always fun to play with. The only drawback is that after playing for a year, the connection parts are more and more loose and can’t attach tightly to each other sometimes.
customer_reviews.author: Ying Lu

customer_reviews.title: Warning: Shipped without a shipping box - could spoil a surprise!
customer_reviews.text: 11/2017: Purchased this again to add to my grandson's collection. This product was shipped by Amazon without a shipping box. The mailing label was stuck on the actual TinkerToy box. I am going to open it to verify that all the contents are inside, but wanted to warn other buyers that this could potentially ruin a "surprise" if the kids live where it is delivered. 12/2015: 5 year old grandson loves these. I enjoyed building with him Christmas day, giving him ideas on what he could do with them.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bateman

customer_reviews.title: Won't Last Very Long
customer_reviews.text: When my four-year old grandson opened his tinkertoys, he was so happy and engaged. He could not put them down. But now he is sooooo frustrated. They don't stick together any more. So disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Decent toy but better suited for kids ages 5 and older
customer_reviews.text: My parent's kept my set of Tinker Toys as a child and my four year old son loves playing with them at their house. I bought him this set for Christmas because he loves them so much. The new set is more bendable, but I think it's almost better for kids who are a little older than him. This set has about 20 smaller pieces that could be a choking hazard for my 1 year old, so I had to remove them entirely from the set. My sons (4 and 2.5) have the best time making simple toy swords from the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: HHobson

customer_reviews.title: Kids love these
customer_reviews.text: This is a great set with enough pieces for kids to be creative. They are a little hard to get apart sometimes, but the creative side of these is amazing. My son and daughter love these
customer_reviews.author: Emily M.

customer_reviews.title: Blast from the Past
customer_reviews.text: Growing up, my siblings and I enjoyed the wooden version of this toy. Although there is still a wooden one being sold, this plastic version has more pieces, and can create more things with the flexible parts than the wooden ones would have been able to. Great toy for inventive minds who love to create, pretend, and make believe.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Niles

customer_reviews.title: Daughter Loves Them!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter absolutely loved this set! The pieces hold up under a toddler's use and the instructions provided were great. My daughter looked at the pictures and was able to recreate them. She is always making new things with these Tinker Toys and is always asking mom and dad to come create with her. I would definitely recommend these toys.
customer_reviews.author: MurFam

customer_reviews.title: Great quality!! highly recommend these!
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these (he's 5) but I can see him playing with them for quite a while to come. Great quality, lots of fun creative options. Pricey but good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Nikki

customer_reviews.title: My kids could play with these all day and be happy
customer_reviews.text: Scratch the order for a hippopotamus. Kids want tinker toys for Christmas. My kids love spending hours building and exploring their imaginations with these. I will be ordering more boxes.
customer_reviews.author: Genevieve

customer_reviews.title: Fun toy, but not what you remember
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad product over all, but it isn't really the same as old school tinker toys. My kids still enjoy the set, but it's disappointing to see that the product has changed so much.
customer_reviews.author: VuULF

customer_reviews.title: Not like the old, but the new is just as good!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't super excited to notice they were not like the old, but that is because they are better! They don't break as easy. Some are flexible which is nice for different designs. Kids love them and so do I! I felt like a kid again when building with them.
customer_reviews.author: Adam crandall

customer_reviews.title: Extra, Extra, read all about it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Grandkids are going to use them today. Some buyers mentioned parts were shorted. Did inventory and all parts checked out. However, we received an extra windmill vane. 😁
customer_reviews.author: bobfp

customer_reviews.title: Requires advanced hand strength to assemble
customer_reviews.text: It says ages 3+ but it was very difficult pretty much impossible for my 3 year old to snap the plastic pieces together. He only played with it when I was there helping. I ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Brya

customer_reviews.title: so wasn't sure if I was going to like the upgraded model
customer_reviews.text: I played with the wood version of these as a kid, so wasn't sure if I was going to like the upgraded model. I shouldn't have worried. These are great. All the fun building options as the original plus more. They are a bit hard to pull apart for small kids, but they fit well and hold up to many hours of use!
customer_reviews.author: E. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Train kid's brain
customer_reviews.text: my boy like to use this toy to build all different car, gun and building! He will create the building he watch on the movie. this toy is good for the boy to train his brain!
customer_reviews.author: Betty Lu

customer_reviews.title: Better Than Classic
customer_reviews.text: I have had several sets of classic wooden Tinkertoys. Didn't know if I or my 9yr old granddaugher would like a plastic set. But she loves them...seems to be easier to fit things together and has the advantage that some long parts are flexible so may new shapes can be assembled. We have only had the set for a couple of weeks so maybe or time the plastic breaksdown or doesn't hold shape or something...but right now why go back to wooden pieces.
customer_reviews.author: Tom254

customer_reviews.title: Perfect toy
customer_reviews.text: We love this set. It was an Easter gift for my 3 year old and he has played with it every day. There aren't many toys that are that engaging to him. He asks me to build him the models from the pamphlet, but is also able to entertain himself by clicking pieces together or sorting pieces by shape and color. When he builds tall constructions he tries to figure out how to balance them. I feel that he's learning a lot. I will probably buy him more boxes to be able to make bigger creations.
customer_reviews.author: Momof2

customer_reviews.title: They’re fun and very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve actually had these for several years now, and they still do everything they ever did. Pieces fit together very snugly so that there’s no danger of your structure falling apart. Indeed, sometimes they’re hard to take apart once they’re built.
customer_reviews.author: RhondaB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing for a child with a big imagination
customer_reviews.text: I can’t even tell you how many things my nephew has made with this set. He has an amazing imagination so we thought this would be the perfect gift. I have never been more right.
customer_reviews.author: Desiloo17

customer_reviews.title: He seems to like them a lot
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 3 year old nephew. He seems to like them a lot. I grew up with the wooden ones and wasn't sure how I felt about these being 100% plastic but they're very well built and solid. They'll probably hold up better than the wood. They're not compatible with the older wooden sets which is too bad.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S.

customer_reviews.title: CLASSIC TOY
customer_reviews.text: Our grandsons love these Tinkertoys. They are durable and well made, to allow for little hands in constructing and experimenting. The pamphlet of design ideas is great and allowed for some awesome projects. Highly recommnded for kids of all ages!
customer_reviews.author: Lory L.

customer_reviews.title: One of my favorite childhood toys improved!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this toy and can play with it for a long toy. Perfect for pre-schoolers still a bit young for Kinex, glad we bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Hard to play with
customer_reviews.text: Quality is not bad; however definitely not for 3 years old! Too difficult to take apart even for an adult!
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Nice Building Set
customer_reviews.text: My children enjoyed this building set. At the beginning it was kind of hard to stick the pieces to each other, but after spending some time playing, sticking / taking apart, it becomes easy to handle for 4-5 year old kid. Overall it is worth its price and gives your kid an opportunity to create different ideas to build. Only thing I wish it had a little more pieces, lets say 250 - 300.
customer_reviews.author: Asel

customer_reviews.title: Meh
customer_reviews.text: I knew these were the newer version, but you can't do much with them. They still have fun with them sometimes, but not quite the excitement we were hoping for.
customer_reviews.author: Alyssa

customer_reviews.title: My kids really enjoyed these.
customer_reviews.text: My kids really enjoyed these. ....use them for so many make believe circumstances! I would highly advise to go with the bigger set, so much more versatile with more pieces and great for 2 kids to use together. I was looking for the old wooden style, but so glad I found these. ....pieces are easy to clean/disinfect too
customer_reviews.author: twoyearold

customer_reviews.title: Almost like the originals
customer_reviews.text: Almost like the originals, some additional parts. If my great grand son likes his as much as I did 75 years ago they are wonderful and all indications so fare are he does.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Rich

customer_reviews.title: We build things together all the time and I love that it encourages his imagination
customer_reviews.text: My 3 year old son loves this toy. We build things together all the time and I love that it encourages his imagination. The parts are kid friendly and sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Christmas
customer_reviews.text: I bought two boxes for my 3 year old for Christmas based on the reviews and the prime day sale. We shall see. If they’re like the same tinker toys I had as a kid, I’m sure she’ll have a blast.
customer_reviews.author: swampmamma

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old grandson loves these. My kids had the wooden kind and I really think these are better. I’ll probably buy more of these. Some of the pieces are small and could be a choking hazard for younger kids who still put toys in their mouth.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Our 4 yr old loves them!
customer_reviews.text: We bought these for my 4 yr old for Christmas last year. He really enjoys building with these. I love that they are not wooden like the ones I used to have as a child, so they don't break. He really enjoys following the suggested things to build in the instruction pamphlet. It's a great activity for him to build his spatial skills, dexterity, and reading building plans. He enjoys the independence he can have while building with these. It seems to be a favorite activity to keep himself occupied during rest time.
customer_reviews.author: alorett

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: These are not the TinkerToys of my childhood. They are made from plastic and some pieces are flexible. My grandchildren cannot get enough of these TinkerToys. They build, build and rebuild. We now have 300 pieces and I think we are going to need more! Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.author: Grandma Chicken

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: Kids absolutely love these! This was a second purchase of this set because they had so much fun with the first one.
customer_reviews.author: mom

customer_reviews.title: Great set!
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my boys for Christmas (9&6). This is a great set with small and big things to build. Easy to follow instructions and much less frustrating than k’nex. I also love that the box is durable enough to keep for storing the pieces.
customer_reviews.author: KLF

customer_reviews.title: Super 200 piece is for the larger building toys
customer_reviews.text: This review, is what I said mistakenly for the 100 piece set! Super 200 piece is for the larger building toys....it is great. The smaller 100 piece is for building smaller pieces, just as good for a 3 years old as the 200 is for a 4 /5 year boy.
customer_reviews.author: Maxine S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy I remember from my childhood!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these tinker toys on a lightning deal and got a great deal! These are a great toy for autistic children who love to build things. My friend's autistic son is obsessed with these after we found some at a garage sale so I was super excited to find them on Amazon at a wonderful price! I would definitely recommend tinker toys!!!
customer_reviews.author: mcachenson

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just gave this to my grandson for his birthday on Aug 28. It is missing pieces! Cannot return for a replacement because the return deadline was Aug 17. It had not been opened because it was a birthday gift! VERY disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great toys for creative kids
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with my purchase of the TinkerToy Model Super Building Set. This was a gift for my 8 year old granddaughter, and she loves it! It arrived exactly as described and on time. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: ALICE1

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: These are so much fun. I love watching my four year old and six year old build stuff together.
customer_reviews.author: Alexis B.

customer_reviews.title: Love this set!
customer_reviews.text: Our son and his little friends love playing with this set! (Dad loves it even more than they do 😉). The pieces fit together flawlessly. Super easy for 2 or even 3 people to play side by side. I can tell it will last for years and years.
customer_reviews.author: Cari

customer_reviews.title: A timeless toy that lasts forever
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these to add to a set of Tinkertoys that belonged to my husband when he was young. They are nearly 60 years old and the grandchildren still love to play with them. I know they’ll enjoy these as well.
customer_reviews.author: Cydney Stovall

customer_reviews.title: Great creative toy
customer_reviews.text: My grandsons enjoy creating with an older set from our son but we didn’t have enough pieces. Ordered this set and they are thrilled. It connects well with our older set and I keep it all in a rubber maid tub with lid.
customer_reviews.author: Annette P.

customer_reviews.title: Fun & Creative
customer_reviews.text: My grandson has a lot of legos so I bought this for something different. He really liked it & has built several things. He is six.
customer_reviews.author: Mason's Grandma

customer_reviews.title: They loved them, but I could not part with them ...
customer_reviews.text: The Tinker Toys more than met my expectations and those of my 15 year old granddaughter who they were purchased for. My 3 grandchildren grew up playing with what was left of my set I received 55 years ago. They loved them, but I could not part with them so they now have a new updated set to play with. Thank you for carrying this product and if the manufacture reads this thank you for making a wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie L. Burnett

customer_reviews.title: but they have fun and it's great to see what their imaginations come ...
customer_reviews.text: The possibilities are endless with this box of tinker toys. It keeps my 3 and 4 year old occupied for HOURS if I let them. Sure there are lots of small parts and it can be a chore to clean up, but they have fun and it's great to see what their imaginations come up with.
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: I bought 2 of these tinker toyhs, one for ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these tinker toyhs, one for our grandson at his house and one for him at our house. he is enjoying the challenges the building set provides. He is 5 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Janet H. Barndt

customer_reviews.title: Good starter set
customer_reviews.text: Colorful. Good starter set. Allows children to use their imagination
customer_reviews.author: Sandra Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set they are plastic instead of wood like the older ones but still overall nice
customer_reviews.author: Dreyc + HaileyJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gift, hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: My 3-year-old loves it! Just as fun to build with as an adult, as well. Has a few models to go by in the direction pamphlet, but to get more patterns you have to go online and redeem them. I’d recommend this toy to any kid who loves to build & any parent with an imagination.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea P.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent toy for all
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent toy for all children our daughter loves this and has had other versions of this over the last eight years and is something she goes back too This would be in the top 10 toy purchases of the last eight years
customer_reviews.author: Vixb

customer_reviews.title: Great for the imagination
customer_reviews.text: I liked that there were many pieces to build bridges, cars and rollers. Great building set for making all sorts of items!
customer_reviews.author: Mam

customer_reviews.title: My kids love these
customer_reviews.text: These are the most fought over toy in my house. We should probably buy another set, but then there will be even more parts for me to step on.
customer_reviews.author: Lara Shelton

customer_reviews.title: bought as a gift - I hope the plastic holds ...
customer_reviews.text: bought as a gift - I hope the plastic holds up as well as the old fashioned wood tinker toys.
customer_reviews.author: Albanygolfer

customer_reviews.title: Love tinker toys!
customer_reviews.text: We grew up with tinker toys, my kids grew up with tinker toys, and my grandkids are growing up with tinker toys. This toy is timeless!! These tinker toys are plastic but still fun and so bright and colorful. My grand daughter loves them and it is a refreshing alternative to today's electronic toy world! Studies show time and time again how important creativity is to brain development. Love this toy
customer_reviews.author: Peggy R

customer_reviews.title: I'm assuming it's okay
customer_reviews.text: I gave these Tinker Toys as a gift. I haven't heard anything bad.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: Great for 3-90 yr olds
customer_reviews.text: These were a real hit! Should have bought a few more boxes!
customer_reviews.author: MICHELE TELLEZ

customer_reviews.title: Wonferful
customer_reviews.text: We use these for team building exercises and they are well made and hold together well!
customer_reviews.author: ejvwsc

customer_reviews.title: Both children loved it (boy and girl) I loved that it wasn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Both children loved it (boy and girl) I loved that it wasn't electronic and that it reasonably priced. Will definitely buy additional kits.
customer_reviews.author: Slwest

customer_reviews.title: Kids approved, ages 2 - 10
customer_reviews.text: Would buy again, and would buy a second set so the kids can have more to play with when they play together.
customer_reviews.author: B3T5

customer_reviews.title: Great toy
customer_reviews.text: Liked the bright colors. Calling the box a “convenient storage container” is a stretch. It’s a lightweight box.
customer_reviews.author: Chanceroos

customer_reviews.title: An update to a classic toy
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my kids and has provided them with quite a bit of entertainment. Can be hard to separate pieces at times but that is what parents are for
customer_reviews.author: drcotto

product_meta.title: TINKERTOY 30 Model 200 Piece Super Building Set - Preschool Learning Educational Toy for Girls and Boys 3+ (Amazon Exclusive)
product_meta.description:
Make learning time exciting with the TINKERTOY 30 Model Super Building Set ! This set consists of 200 brightly colored plastic parts, including spools, flags, washers, rods, and end caps. Some parts are flexible enough to bend into the structure you’re making. TINKERTOY parts Snap Together, Stay Together for long-lasting play. The parts are easy to put together, and they stay together for great after-build play. With 30 ideas for models to build, this set of durable plastic pieces can unleash your kids’ engineering skills as they build such structures as castles, houses, bicycles, cool creatures, and more.

TINKERTOY 30 Model Super Building Set improves your child’s learning through STEAM (science, technology, engineering, arts & math) concepts. Creating models helps them hone their analytical skills, fine motor skills, hand-eye coordination, imagination, and spatial awareness.

Each set includes TINKERTOY parts, an instruction sheet with 30 building ideas, and a sturdy, portable box. Wherever you go, your kids can play and build with this set. The box is durable enough to hold your TINKERTOY parts when they’re not in use.

TINKERTOY spools, rods, flags, washers, and end caps are responsibly made in the USA at a landfill-free, zero-waste green manufacturing facility in Hatfield, Pennsylvania. We test to the strictest quality and safety standards, ensuring that your child has a successful, trouble-free building experience.
feature_bullets: FUN AND COLORFUL – Enjoy interactive fun and excitement with the TINKERTOY 30 Model Super Building Set! This set contains 200 brightly colored classic parts, including spools, flags, washers, rods, and end caps. With 30 models to build, these durable plastic pieces can unleash your kids’ engineering talents as they build castles, houses, bicycles, friendly creatures, and more.

ADVANCED PRESCHOOL LEARNING – The TINKERTOY 30 Model Super Building Set advances your child’s education with STEAM concepts. The creation of models lets children hone their analytical skills and imaginations.

FLEXIBLE CONSTRUCTION PIECES – The durable plastic pieces are 100% authentic, safe to use and they are made in the USA. Some rods and connectors are flexible enough to bend into your intended structures, allowing for a greater range of creations. They’re simple to assemble and disassemble, making it easier for your kids to design their own constructions.

CONVENIENT STORAGE – Each set includes TINKERTOY parts, an instructional sheet with 30 building ideas, and a sturdy box, so that wherever you go your kids can play and build with this set. The box is portable and durable enough to hold your TINKERTOY parts when they’re not in use.

SNAPS TOGETHER, STAYS TOGETHER– Gone are the days of your favorite TINKERTOY model falling apart. TINKERTOY sets now snap together and stay together, for long-lasting play. The parts are easy to put together, and they stay together for great after-build play.
